p: We evaluated TMR-001, a proprietary bulk drug substance solution of ranpirnase, an RNase A enzyme, extracted from oocytes of Northern leopard frogs Lithobates pipiens, formerly Rana pipiens [ 7]. Other forms of the drug were developed under the names Pannon, P-30, and Onconase for Injection (TMR-004) as an antitumor agent [ 8, 9]. Based on studies showing selective cytotoxicity in transformed cells [ 10], TMR-004, manufactured by Alfacell Inc., was advanced to phase III clinical trials for mesothelioma treatment [ 11, 12]. In these trials the drug was administered to more than one thousand patients [ 13]. It was found to have low immunogenicity and was well-tolerated with few side effects [ 14].
